awd_titl_txt: Nueta Hidatsa Sahnish College (NHSC) Targeted STEM Infusion Project
awd_abstract_narration:
A goal of the Tribal Colleges and Universities Program (TCUP) is to increase the science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) instructional and research capacities of specific institutions of higher education that serve the Nation's indigenous students. Expanding the STEM curricular offerings at these institutions expands the opportunities for their students to pursue challenging, rewarding careers in STEM fields, provides for research studies in areas that may be culturally significant, and encourages a community and generational appreciation for science and mathematics education. This project aligns directly with that goal, and moreover will enhance the Nation's knowledge of the impact of providing relevant STEM instruction on recruiting and retaining underrepresented individuals into STEM studies, and preparing the next generation of STEM professionals. For those students entering the workforce directly from the college, it is important that they have a well-defined skill set in mathematics, science, and technology for entry into the STEM workforce. 

Nueta Hidatsa Sahnish College in New Town, ND will develop a new AS degree in Sustainable Energy Technologies that incorporates culturally relevant concepts and uses constructivist methods. Additional work will be done to address recruitment and retention in STEM, expand undergraduate research opportunities in the energy field, and engage the community.  This project addresses the need for a larger STEM-educated workforce in the energy field on the Fort Berthold reservation and in the state of North Dakota by expanding the STEM instructional capacity of a tribal college.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
Nueta Hidatsa Sahnish College (NHSC) Targeted STEM Infusion Project Grant# 1564156

Nueta Hidatsa Sahnish College (NHSC) in New Town, ND developed a new AS degree in Sustainable Energy Technologies (SET) that incorporates culturally relevant concepts and uses constructivist methods. The AS degree in SET was approved by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC) in the Fall of 2021. NHSC is the first tribal college in North Dakota to have this degree. In the Spring of 2021 NHSC had its first two graduates in the SET AS degree.

Additionally, NHSC still works on recruitment and retention in STEM and has expanded the undergraduate research opportunities in the energy field and engage the community. Our biggest recruitment getter is our traveling Solar Trailer. This trailer has been utilized as a recruiting show and informational booth at numerous, local schools and community gatherings. The trailer has a Solar Photovoltaics racking system that can be assembled on the trailer itself. On the inside of the trailer there is a tv that has a slide show of how the system works. The TV itself along with the lights are ran off the Solar panels and batteries.

This project addresses the need for a larger STEM-educated workforce in the energy field on the Fort Berthold reservation and in the state of North Dakota by expanding the STEM instructional capacity of a tribal college. We have two photovoltaics courses in our curriculum once those two courses are completed the students have the option to take a test to become Level 1 Certified Residential Solar Installers though ETA® International. Once they are certified they can go out and start their own company or apply to work for any residential solar installing companies.

 


Last Modified: 01/03/2022
Modified by: Kerry E Hartman

The AS degree in SET was approved by the Higher Learning Commission (HLC) in the Fall of 2021. NHSC is the first tribal college in North Dakota to have this degree.
